description: push +â€Ž down; by analogy with a spring-loaded stack of plates in a cafeteria.

entries.meaning: (computing) Describing a stack in which items are removed in a LIFO manner from the end at which they were added.

examples: Since indexed grammars are context-free grammars with pushdowns, the generalization of Thatcher's result shows that they generate the yields of the tree languages recognized by deterministic pushdown tree automata.
